704517f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Joralemon Street
704517f-a.text:
Fulton Street, east from Joralemon Street. At the right, on Jora-
lemon Street, are the King's County Court House and the Hall of Record,
followed by the King's County Trust Co. At the left, the Citizen Building
houses the ''Brooklyn Daily Citizen''. The Boerum Place station of the Fulto
Street elevated lines may also be seen.
About 1900.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
704517f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY

705167f.title: Brooklyn: Joralemon Street - Fulton Street
705167f.text:
Joralemon Street, south side, at Fulton Street. A view of Kings
County Court.
1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
705167f.folder: Joralemon Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704518f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Joralemon Street
704518f-a.text:
Fulton Street (elevated structure thereon), south side, east from
its intersection with Joralemon Street, showing a general view southeastward
as seen from the Temple Bar Building which is located on the west side of
Court Street (No. 44) at the N.W. corner of Joralemon Street. At the right
of the Fulton Street Elevated line, beginning with the foreground, are in
their order, the following buildings; namely, the new and old Munteipal
Buildings, and the Hall of Records. The triangular roofed building to the
left is at the intersection of Wtlloughby and Fulton Streets. The
elevated station is on Boerum Place.
May 1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
704518f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY

704516f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Joralemon Street
704516f-a.text:
Fulton Street, at its intersection with Joralemon, Adams and Willeughby
Streets, showing the Fulton Street Elevated line of the B.M.T. TRe center
building is the City Hall, with the Brooklyn Citizen's Bank Building on the
left.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
704516f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY

702948f-a.title: Brooklyn: Adams Street - Fulton Street
702948f-a.text:
Adams Street, west side, south to Fulton Street, from 366 at right
foreground. In the background, is seen the Fulton Street ''Elevated'' struct-
ure, and the Hall of Aecords building; to the right of them, is a building
oocupied by the ''Brooklyn Daily Citizen'', established in 1386. It was built
by one Jones in 1842, and was the first home of the N. Y. \& N. J. Telephone
Co., of Brooklyn.
1928.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.
MAY DE REPRODUCED.
702948f-a.folder: Adams Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY
